intro: Belonophora coffeoides, commonly known as the coffeeberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 14,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are edible and have a slightly tart flavor. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, contributing to its ornamental value.
